nodes.text: Forgive me for my forwardness, but you would perhaps make a better impression upon other people if you did not wear pandas.
Hey, I wear panda because I can-da. I think it makes a paws-itive impression on those I bear-ly know.
One must wonder whether you are deliberately flouting sartorial convention or whether you are simply ignorant of how ridiculous you look. I sincerely hope that it is the former.
Do you mean to tell me that pandas are so last year? And here I thought I was being trendy.
My dear Shawn O'Conner, I beg you, please do not continue to wear panda paraphernalia. It shows a distinct want of sensibility.
What's the matter, Joel? Are you afraid I'll start a panda-emic? I think that they are quite pawsh!
You are looking particularly distinguished today, Mr. O'Conner. Leather is a very good look for you.
If it's true that Clothes Maketh the Man, then I am clearly a made man.
I must say, Mr. O'Conner, that you are looking rather dashing today.
Thanks. I never used to think about what I wore. However, you always look so dapper, so apparently apparel is important.
Mr. O'Conner, if you do not mind my saying so, you wear those clothes very well.
Mr. Kyro, if you don't mind my saying so, thank you. I want to make a good impression.
It is good to see that you have been taking such an interest in your appearance lately.
Thanks. I'm going for that "Dress for excess" style.
You look like a veritable 'Prince of Thieves' today, Mr. O'Conner.
I'm going for that "Reigning Ruler of Rogues" look - 'Watch out, world, I'm going to steal your heart!"
I see that you are going with the Official University Uniform look today, Mr. O'Conner. It has a certain cachet.
I chose some clothes that would outclass this rogue class.
There's nothing I want to say to him now.
